title: How we created an effective, game-based team feedback framework
OpenTelemetry Python Implementation Deep Dive
description: OpenTelemetry is a set of libraries, agents and other components that enable the generation and collection of telemetry data. Applications and libraries use the OpenTelemetry API to record information (telemetry) about the different performed operations. The telemetry data usually includes the start and end times, attributes for the operation (headers in an http request for instance), type of operation, result, etc. Our previous A Shallow Dive Into Distributed Tracing blog-post presents a nice introduction to distributed tracing and OpenTelemetry.

title: Why is there a "V" in SIGSEGV Segmentation Fault?
